definition: to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)

sentences.english: This, in fact, was not reported in the Prophetic Sunnah, and there is no evidence on it.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，圣训中没有这样的传述，也没有明显的证据。

sentences.english: People believe me the more I am quoted.
sentences.chinese: 我被传述得越多，人们就会更相信我。

sentences.english: And tell its raptures all abroad.
A great deal of frontier humour was oral.
sentences.chinese: 边疆幽默有一大部分是由口头传述的。

sentences.english: Unless they are proper books written by sages, we should avoid reading them.
sentences.chinese: 若非圣贤所传述的正经书，一定摒弃不看。

sentences.english: I wouldn't give tongue to such gossip.

definition: Ayshe, Aise or Ayesha (name)/Aishah bint Abi Bakr (c. 614-678), youngest wife of prophet Mohamed 穆罕默德[Mu4 han3 mo4 de2]/also written 阿伊莎
Ayshe, Aise or Ayesha (name)/Aishah bint Abi Bakr (c. 614-678), youngest wife of prophet Mohamed 穆罕默德[Mu4 han3 mo4 de2]
Matthew/St Matthew the evangelist/less common variant of 馬太|马太[Ma3 tai4] (preferred by the Catholic Church)
Mohammed (c. 570-632), central figure of Islam and prophet of God
